A general version of the spatial model including both the spatial lag term and a spatially correlated error structure is shown as
y = ρW 1 y + Xβ + μ
μ = λW 2 μ + ε
ε ~ N (0, σ 2 I n ), (5) where y denotes an n × 1 vector of response variable observations collected at n cities; X is an n × k matrix representing explanatory variables; ε is an n × 1 vector of normally distributed (with constant variance σ 2 ) stochastic disturbances; n is the total number of cities; k is the number of explanatory variables incorporated into the regression model; W 1 and W 2 are n × n spatial weight matrices, usually containing contiguity relations; the parameter ρ is a coefficient on the spatially lagged response variable (
W 1
y
); β represents the regression coefficients to be estimated to reflect the influence of the explanatory variables X on the variation of the response variable y; the parameter λ is a coefficient on the spatially correlated error μ; and I n is an n × n unit matrix.
